hr.fer.zemris.ml.model.random_forest

Class ClassificationRandomForest

  • java.lang.Object
    • hr.fer.zemris.ml.model.random_forest.RandomForest<java.lang.String>
      • hr.fer.zemris.ml.model.random_forest.ClassificationRandomForest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IPredictor<java.lang.String>, java.io.Serializable

    public class ClassificationRandomForest
extends RandomForest<java.lang.String>
    Classification random forest model. Target class is represented with a String value.
    Author:
    Dan
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        Creates a new random forest model with given decision trees, but discards their training samples for easier serialization of the model.
        Parameters:
        trees - decision trees
        numOfFeatures - number of features training samples had
        allClasses - all possible class values

        target value prediction

      • getAllClasses

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getAllClasses()

      • calculateClassProbabilities

        public double[] calculateClassProbabilities(double[] features)
        Asks every decision tree in this model for a prediction based on given features and returns an array with probabilities for each class.

        Value at index i is probability that given features correspond to class at index i in the List returned by getAllClasses(). If none of the trees vote for a class, the probability at that index will be 0.

        predict(double[]) will return the class with the highest probability.

        Parameters:
        features - features to consider for prediction
        Returns:
        an array of probabilities
